awd_abstract_narration: This proposal requests funds for the development of a pulse                     field-sweep EPR (PFSEPR) and to extend its application as a                     simple but powerful tool for probing electron nuclear and                       electron-electron spin interactions.  This technique will be a                  simple, economical alternative to technically complex ENDOR,                    ELDOR, and spin echo methods.  The prinicpal investigator                       proposes to improve the EPR sensitivity of PFSEPR, improve its                  resolution of both large and small hyperfine couplings, and                     improve its time resolution for resolving dynamic interactions.                 He will also develop a minimal PFSEPR modification so that the                  PFSEPR technique will become more accessible to the                             nonspecialist.  Dr. Scholes, one of only a few EPR/ENDOR experts,               has the expertise necessary to develop this tool that could be of               wide use in chemical and biochemical problems.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK, THE
